# <a id="OLE_LINK1"></a>Form “Containers”<a id="footnote-ref-1"></a>[\[1\]](#footnote-1)

## Screens

![](data:image/png;base64,)Is the hard of a PowerApps application \- this article covers the “canvas” app which have screens with a fixed ratio, so if you view your app on different devices, the screens will scale to fit as instead being reactive \- that is reacting to the change of height and/or width by changing what is display

You use PowerApps Studio to design your app\.

[Screens](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-gb/powerapps/maker/canvas-apps/add-screen-context-variables)

## List

![](data:image/png;base64,)

## Edit 

A form basically have 2 modes, either Edit or Display

When you have an Edit mode form, you are responsible for offering some way of cancelling the edit, save and may be also delete the current record\.

## View

Oppose to edit, display forms shall not have any options for altering and saving content, but could have the option for deleting\.
